net.gotev.uploadservice.http

Interface HttpConnection

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HurlStackConnection

    public interface HttpConnection
    Defines the methods that has to be implemented by an HTTP connection. If you're implementing your custom HTTP connection, remember to never cache anything, especially in BodyWriter methods, as this will surely cause memory issues when uploading large files. The only things which you are allowed to cache are the response code and body from the server, which must not be large though.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  HttpConnection.RequestBodyDelegate
      Delegate called when the body is ready to be written.

        HttpConnection setHeaders(List<NameValue> requestHeaders)
                   throws IOException
        Set request headers.
        Parameters:
        requestHeaders - request headers to set
        Returns:
        instance
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs while setting request headers

      • setTotalBodyBytes

        HttpConnection setTotalBodyBytes(long totalBodyBytes,
                                 boolean isFixedLengthStreamingMode)
        Sets the total body bytes.
        Parameters:
        totalBodyBytes - total number of bytes
        isFixedLengthStreamingMode - true if the fixed length streaming mode must be used. If it's false, chunked streaming mode has to be used
        Returns:
        instance

      • getResponse

        ServerResponse getResponse(HttpConnection.RequestBodyDelegate delegate)
                    throws IOException
        Gets the server response.
        Parameters:
        delegate - delegate which handles the writing of the request body
        Returns:
        object containing the server response status, headers and body.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs while getting the server response

        void close()
        Closes the connection and frees all the allocated resources.
